BoundBox.doc:
The following illustrates the orientation of the bounding box in local space. 
			 
			 Z  Y
			 | /
			 |/
			 .-----X
			 
			 
			     2----------6
			    /|         /|
			   / |        / |
			  1----------5  |
			  |  |       |  |
			  |  3-------|--7
			  | /        | /
			  |/         |/
			  0----------4

fields.vec: The 8 vectors with 3 components (xyz) (see class documentation).

Object.doc:
An instance of BlenderObject represents an element of a scene such as a graphical object, camera, source of sound or light etc..

There are the following types of objects:

Nametype id
(see {@link #getType()})		Data type
(see {@link #getData()})
OB_EMPTY0--
OB_MESH1{@link Mesh}
OB_CURVE2{@link Curve}
OB_SURF3{@link Curve}
OB_FONT4{@link Curve}
OB_MBALL5{@link MetaBall}
OB_LAMP10{@link Lamp}
OB_CAMERA11{@link Camera}
OB_SPEAKER12{@link Speaker}
OB_WAVE21deprecated?
OB_LATTICE22{@link Lattice}
OB_ARMATURE25{@link bArmature}

The type of an object defines what type of data is to be retrieved from {@link #getData()}.

fields.partype:
parent type: first 4 bits: type. 
					PARTYPE       = (1 << 4) - 1,
					PAROBJECT     = 0,
					PARCURVE      = 1,
					PARKEY        = 2,
					PARSKEL       = 4,
					PARVERT1      = 5,
					PARVERT3      = 6,
					PARBONE       = 7,
					PARSLOW       = 16,
fields.proxy: if ob->proxy (or proxy_group), this object is proxy for object ob->proxy
fields.proxy_group: if ob->proxy (or proxy_group), this object is proxy for object ob->proxy
fields.proxy_from: proxy_from is set in target back to the proxy.
fields.bb: Bounding box of the associated mesh/curve/etc. Cache value not necessarily stored in file.
fields.data: pointer to objects data - an 'ID' or NULL
fields.avs: settings for visualization of object-transform animation
fields.mpath: motion path cache for this object
fields.defbase: list of bDeformGroup (vertex groups) names and flag only
fields.mode:
Local object mode. On of: 
					OB_MODE_OBJECT        = 0,
					OB_MODE_EDIT          = 1 << 0,
					OB_MODE_SCULPT        = 1 << 1,
					OB_MODE_VERTEX_PAINT  = 1 << 2,
					OB_MODE_WEIGHT_PAINT  = 1 << 3,
					OB_MODE_TEXTURE_PAINT = 1 << 4,
					OB_MODE_PARTICLE_EDIT = 1 << 5,
					OB_MODE_POSE          = 1 << 6
fields.restore_mode: Keep track of what mode to return to after toggling a mode
fields.mat:
Material slots. Pointer on a list of pointers on instances of {@link Material}.
see {@link #getTotcol()}
fields.matbits: a boolean field, with each byte 1 if corresponding material is linked to object
fields.totcol: Number of available material slots (see {@link #getMat()}). Copy of {@link Mesh#getTotcol()}, {@link Curve#getTotcol()} and meta struct member of same name (keep in sync).
fields.actcol: currently selected material slot in the UI
fields.obmat: final worldspace matrix with constraints & animsys applied
fields.parentinv: inverse result of parent, so that object doesn't 'stick' to parent
fields.constinv: inverse result of constraints. doesn't include effect of parent or object local transform
fields.imat:
inverse matrix of 'obmat' for any other use than rendering! 
							note: this isn't assured to be valid as with 'obmat',
	                     	before using this value you should do...
	                    	invert_m4_m4(ob->imat, ob->obmat);
fields.imat_ren:
Previously 'imat' was used at render time, but as other places use it too
	 							the interactive ui of 2.5 creates problems. So now only 'imat_ren' should
								be used when ever the inverse of ob->obmat * re->viewmat is needed!
fields.lay: copy of Base's layer in the scene
fields.transflag:
transformation settings and transform locks. Flags 1 and 2 were unused or relics from past features. 
					OB_NEG_SCALE        = 1 << 2,
					OB_DUPLIFRAMES      = 1 << 3,
					OB_DUPLIVERTS       = 1 << 4,
					OB_DUPLIROT         = 1 << 5,
					OB_DUPLINOSPEED     = 1 << 6,
					OB_DUPLIGROUP       = 1 << 8,
					OB_DUPLIFACES       = 1 << 9,
					OB_DUPLIFACES_SCALE = 1 << 10,
					OB_DUPLIPARTS       = 1 << 11,
					OB_RENDER_DUPLI     = 1 << 12,
					OB_NO_CONSTRAINTS   = 1 << 13,  --> runtime constraints disable
					OB_NO_PSYS_UPDATE   = 1 << 14,  --> hack to work around particle issue
					OB_DUPLI            = OB_DUPLIFRAMES | OB_DUPLIVERTS | OB_DUPLIGROUP | OB_DUPLIFACES | OB_DUPLIPARTS,
fields.trackflag:
transformation settings and transform locks. 
					OB_POSX = 0,
					OB_POSY = 1,
					OB_POSZ = 2,
					OB_NEGX = 3,
					OB_NEGY = 4,
					OB_NEGZ = 5,
fields.upflag:
transformation settings and transform locks. 
					OB_POSX = 0,
					OB_POSY = 1,
					OB_POSZ = 2,
					OB_NEGX = 3,
					OB_NEGY = 4,
					OB_NEGZ = 5,
fields.nlaflag:
used for DopeSheet filtering settings (expanded/collapsed). 
					-- object-channel expanded status --
					OB_ADS_COLLAPSED    = 1 << 10,
					-- object's ipo-block --
					OB_ADS_SHOWIPO      = 1 << 11,
					-- object's constraint channels --
					OB_ADS_SHOWCONS     = 1 << 12,
					-- object's material channels --
					OB_ADS_SHOWMATS     = 1 << 13,
					-- object's marticle channels --
					OB_ADS_SHOWPARTS    = 1 << 14,
fields.scavisflag: more display settings for game logic
fields.inertia:
during realtime. note that inertia is only called inertia for historical reasons
	 				and is not changed to avoid DNA surgery. It actually reflects the 
	 				Size value in the GameButtons (= radius).
fields.formfactor:
The form factor k is introduced to give the user more control
					and to fix incompatibility problems.
					For rotational symmetric objects, the inertia value can be
					expressed as: Theta = k * m * r^2
					where m = Mass, r = Radius
					For a Sphere, the form factor is by default = 0.4
fields.max_vel: clamp the maximum velocity 0.0 is disabled
fields.min_vel: clamp the minimum velocity 0.0 is disabled
fields.rotmode: rotation mode - uses defines set out in DNA_action_types.h for PoseChannel rotations...
fields.collision_boundtype:
bounding box type used for collision. 
					OB_BOUND_BOX           = 0,
					OB_BOUND_SPHERE        = 1,
					OB_BOUND_CYLINDER      = 2,
					OB_BOUND_CONE          = 3,
					OB_BOUND_TRIANGLE_MESH = 4,
					OB_BOUND_CONVEX_HULL   = 5,
					OB_BOUND_CAPSULE       = 7,
fields.dtx:
viewport draw extra settings. Flags: 
					OB_DRAWBOUNDOX    = 1 << 0,
					OB_AXIS           = 1 << 1,
					OB_TEXSPACE       = 1 << 2,
					OB_DRAWNAME       = 1 << 3,
					OB_DRAWIMAGE      = 1 << 4,
					-- for solid+wire display --
					OB_DRAWWIRE       = 1 << 5,
					-- for overdraw s --
					OB_DRAWXRAY       = 1 << 6,
					-- enable transparent draw --
					OB_DRAWTRANSP     = 1 << 7,
					OB_DRAW_ALL_EDGES = 1 << 8,  --> only for meshes currently
fields.dt:
viewport draw type. 
					OB_BOUNDBOX  = 1,
					OB_WIRE      = 2,
					OB_SOLID     = 3,
					OB_MATERIAL  = 4,
					OB_TEXTURE   = 5,
					OB_RENDER    = 6,
					OB_PAINT     = 100,  --> temporary used in draw code
fields.empty_drawtype:
related to viewport drawing. 
					OB_ARROWS        = 1,
					OB_PLAINAXES     = 2,
					OB_CIRCLE        = 3,
					OB_SINGLE_ARROW  = 4,
					OB_CUBE          = 5,
					OB_EMPTY_SPHERE  = 6,
					OB_EMPTY_CONE    = 7,
					OB_EMPTY_IMAGE   = 8,
fields.prop: game logic property list (not to be confused with IDProperties)
fields.actdef: current deformation group, note: index starts at 1
fields.bsoft: settings for game engine bullet soft body
fields.restrictflag: for restricting view, select, render etc. accessible in outliner
fields.body_type:
for now used to temporarily holds the type of collision object. 
	OB_BODY_TYPE_NO_COLLISION   = 0,
	OB_BODY_TYPE_STATIC         = 1,
	OB_BODY_TYPE_DYNAMIC        = 2,
	OB_BODY_TYPE_RIGID          = 3,
	OB_BODY_TYPE_SOFT           = 4,
	OB_BODY_TYPE_OCCLUDER       = 5,
	OB_BODY_TYPE_SENSOR         = 6,
	OB_BODY_TYPE_NAVMESH        = 7,
	OB_BODY_TYPE_CHARACTER      = 8,
fields.shapenr: current shape key for menu or pinned
fields.smoothresh: smoothresh is phong interpolation ray_shadow correction in render
fields.fluidsimSettings: if fluidsim enabled, store additional settings
fields.derivedDeform: this is just a cache which gets initialised by blender on demand
fields.derivedFinal: this is just a cache which gets initialised by blender on demand
fields.lastDataMask: the custom data layer mask that was last used to calculate derivedDeform and derivedFinal
fields.customdata_mask: (extra) custom data layer mask to use for creating derivedmesh, set by depsgraph. <b>See Also:</n> {@link #getLastDataMask()}
fields.state: bit masks of game controllers that are active
fields.init_state: bit masks of initial state as recorded by the users
fields.gpulamp: runtime, for glsl lamp display only
fields.duplilist: for temporary dupli list storage, only for use by RNA API
fields.curve_cache: Runtime valuated curve-specific data, not stored in the file
